reviews.text: I stayed at the Orleans on a last minute trip to Vegas. My friends were already booked in a strip hotel, but it was sold out when I tried to get a room, so I went for something that wasnt to pricey and wasnt too far from the Strip. I had NOT read the reviews on Tripadvsior , and considering the hotel was very inexpensive and off the strip I wasn't expecting alot. On top of that I had heard very little if anything about The Orleans before staying there.
reviews.title: Unexpectedly great.

reviews.text: From first glimpse the lobby and casino are nothing outstanding but certainly nice enough. Check-in was an absolute breeze. I did not have to wait at all, and it was around noon on a Saturday ( a potentially rough time to check-in). Front desk staff offered a strip upgrade for 10 dollars more per night, and considering how low the rate was on my room I figured why not. My room was much better then I expected. It was very large and had a nice bathroom with an interesting view out to the parking lot. The room was a standard , but almost felt like a mimi suite because of its size and its living area. I was very impressed with the room considering the daily rate was less then the tax in other hotels I have stayed in. Another nice point to this hotel is that they have a large selection of great places to eat for very cheap. The Buffet was decent, not the best I have had, but still very enjoyable and inexpensive. Room service was very fast and well priced also. The Orleans pool was not quite to the luxurious level of some of the fancy pools on the strip, but it was not overly crowded either. That is a huge plus. My friends staying at one of the more elite strip hotels even came over to the Orleans with me because their pool was just too crowded. I have been to fancy strip pools enough to know that it can be a nightmare looking for chairs. I did'nt do a lot of gambling at the Orleans, but the Casino was large and not to smokey or crowded. For you sportsbook fans, the Orleans has a very nice one.
reviews.title: Very good hotel for its price
Great Place, Cheap Prices
reviews.text: Although I have stayed at more fancy hotels in Vegas, The Orleans was the best value I have ever come across in town. The only problem some might have is the fact that they are about a mile or so off the strip, but it never seemed to be a problem. I would highly advise every Vegas goer to give this place a try at some point. It gives you a little different perspective and saves you a some money as well.
Our family stayed at this hotel during the 2006 Memorial Day weekend.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel!

reviews.text: Good:
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Hubby and I stayed here for 5 nights. The check in was swift and very informative. The fun books we rec'd were chock full of great coupons.
reviews.title: Perfect
Las Vegas and Kids
reviews.text: We asked for a room near the elevator. We were the 2nd door away from them. Excellent.
The couch had a bad broken spring, so i told them at the front desk. By the time we walked back up to the room, maintenance was already there taking away the couch and replacing it with a new one!
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

reviews.text: Gotta love the window in the shower. Sounds silly, but it really is nice. Feel the vibrance of the Vegas air while getting ready in the morning.
reviews.title: First Class Service

reviews.text: Seattle's Best for coffee in the morning. Took total of 5 minutes to leave room, get coffee, and back to the room. Not bad.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Booked here due to no rooms on the strip available during a large conference in town. Surprisingly, didn't take too long to drive from the strip. Self parking is adequate and not too far a walk. Free shuttle takes you only to other related hotels (Gold Coast, Barbary Coast...) We didn't use this service. Convenient restaurants within the hotel, although mediocre food. Courtyard Cafe tends to never charge for soft drinks. Room and bathroom were good size, although nothing spectacular. Long hallway corridors - ask for a room close to the elevator. Beds were comfortable enough, but no down pillows. Internet is $10.99/24hours, but with unpredictable service. Booked thru priceline and they still tried to charge us on arrival at the hotel. Would only stay here again if there was nothing else available at a cheap price.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: Stayed at the Orlenas from 10/26 thru 11/1. LIke all the reviews I have read, the Orleans is a very good value property. My room was a strip view and I thought it was rather large. Room 1708, good view but about a quarter mile hike from the elevators. I did not have an issue with that but some people might?
reviews.title: 6 Night Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeeper, Patricia, was outstanding!! I spoke with her and gave her my instructions with a very nice tip and for my entire stay the service she provided was excellent!
reviews.title: Great stay at Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You really should have a car if you are staying here. I did so I cannot comment on the shuttle but the valets are very fast and nice. I never waited more than 5 minutes to get my car or to drop it off. I waited 20 minutes at the Monte Carlo trying to make a dinner reservation. That place [--]!
reviews.title: Nice Place Good Value!

reviews.text: I ate a few restaurants at the Orleans and all were good. The Prime Rib loft serves small portions but it's inexpensive. Al's Oyster Bar had the best clam chowder I have eaten and the oysters were good and fresh.
reviews.title: Amazing Value!

likes.disliked: — Waiting for the shuttle bus (although free it can be 15-20 mins)

reviews.text: We paid about $70 CAD/night for this hotel and thought it was a great deal. While it's not the fanciest or classiest hotel, the room was spacious and clean and the pool area was great. The bed was really comfortable too. The free shuttle to the Strip made it easy to get back and forth, although we probably would rent a car next time to venture out a little further and save on all the walking. We only ate breakfast at the cafe, which was average at best.
reviews.title: Good deal, but nothing fancy

reviews.text: I am quite surprised at the good reviews posted on this site about the Orleans. My wife and I stayed at the Orleans last year based on the price offered ($100/weekend night) and the good ratings from this site. Thought we were getting a good deal until we got to Vegas
reviews.title: Not a great hotel
Management needs customer service training!
reviews.text: Location: The Orleans is way off the Strip. It was not a problem for us because we had a car. Since the Tram not up in July 2005, I don't know if it goes to the Orleans. The location is a little hard to get to if you're not familar with Vegas.

reviews.title: A great Hotel off the strip
reviews.text: Hotel:

reviews.title: What Fun
reviews.text: The Exterior: Very dated. It has very little of the glamour and lights that I associate with Vegas. Felt like I was pulling up to a Convention Center.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok so I was wavering between the 4 and 5 rating and decided-what's not to love about this quirky, fun hotel with all the amenities and service you could need? We got a code and paid $30 a night and for the money I couldn't fault the place- great pool area, good gaming, lots of food options for half the strip price, comfortable rooms- I'm pleased to report no bed bugs even though I have the most sensitive of skins, courteous staff and a positively 'Big Easy' atmosphere. The staff at the TGI Friday are the best you'll care to meet (they train the staff at 7 other Fridays in the area) and would recommend the apple mojitos for $5. We've stayed at many hotels in the world and on this trip our next stops were Signature and MGM grand suites but I would have happily stopped here for much longer. If you can get a good rate and enjoy a slightly off strip experience then this is the place for you! Also go to the $250,000 game show at the Hilton- we nearly died with laughing! You can get half price tickets from Tix4Tonight.
reviews.title: 1st choice for value

reviews.text: My husband and I booked a room for the Viva Las Vegas Rockabilly Weekender. The event was held at one of their partner hotels, the Gold Coast. We chose the Orleans because of the discount rates for the event and they offered a free shuttle. The shuttle is a great way to travel to the strip and the Gold Coast. I personally think that they should extend the time the shuttle is in service. The last pickup is 12:30am but they should change it to at least 2am. Midnight is when things are really happening in Vegas.
reviews.title: Rockabilly Weekender

likes.liked: — The 24 hour room service, free shuttle!!
likes.disliked: — Smoke smell in rooms, long walk to room, shuttle should run longer.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: The room that they put us in was so far away and we had to walk forever. The last thing I wanted to do after walking all over the strip is walk a mile through the casino and another mile to our room. Make sure that they put you in a room close to the elevators.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was open and not cramped but the smell of smoke was overwhelming. We were in a non smoking room but the stale scent of cigarettes filled the room. It must be due to poor air circulation in older casinos. The only thing that helped was the fresh air from the small bathroom window. We kept it open the entire time.
reviews.title: Nascar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did order room service one evening at about 2am. It was affordable, quick and very good.
reviews.title: Good Casnio....BAD hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Orleans from Friday Nov 24 - Sunday the 26th. After checking online for the cheapest rate, I called the hotel directly and they matched the price. We arrived early and they checked us in. Unfortunately they did not have two queens available - only a king bed. They said we could get 2 roll away beds (we were traveling with our 8, 5 and 9 month old), but it would cost an extra $15 a night per bed. I wasn't happy about this but what could we do. They told us to check back later to see if anything opened up. Luckily when we checked back - they had a 2 queen room - so we switched without a problem.
reviews.title: Good value for the family

likes.disliked: — Smokey casino, off-strip, charged for coffee in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second room was darker than the first room, but it was completely smoke free (unlike some other smoke free rooms we have stayed in in Vegas) and large. It was also clean. no complaints on the room (especially considering it was MUCH cheaper than hotels on the strip).
reviews.title: please read

reviews.text: Had the breakfast buffet - good food and selection for $6.95 (only $3.50 for the kids). We didn't eat anywhere else at the hotel, so no comments on the other food.
reviews.title: Too Far from the Strip, Stolen Laptop

reviews.text: The tables had low limits (surprising for a holiday weekend) and the dealers were friendly. Tables were crowded - but not impossible to get.
reviews.title: Loved The Orleans

likes.disliked: — sliding wooden door to the bathroom

reviews.text: My older two kids LOVED the Kids Thyme. We dropped them off for three hours on Saturday night and they didn't want to leave when we went to get them. A couple of tips if you are planning on using the kids club. Make reservations. They were turning people away as they were full both Friday and Saturday night. You need to bring a copy of your child's immunization records (this is stated on their website) and the kids must have socks.
reviews.title: We have a winner...

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Orleans for a week. It is a good value for the money. Rooms are large and quiet. Casino seems to always be smokey and the food good. Highly recommend the Prime Rib Loft and a super value there. Gambling was not our main focus but the payouts were fair. Watch out for the coffee makers! We were happy to see they had small coffee pots in the rooms however read the info carefully. Your first cup of coffee or tea is free HOWEVER every cup after that is $1.75. This is not per day but per STAY! I always travel with my favorite brand of instant coffee and tea and therefor did not buy theirs but did use the machine for heating water. After the second day when they realized we were not using their coffee they refused to leave more styrofoam cups. This seems rather petty and I wonder if this is not the first step in nickel and dimeing guests.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We stayed at the Orleans at the end of February, I initially booked our room directly with the hotel but then after searching the web I found a better rate thru another site, but it wasn't a problem since the Orleans will price match whatever you find. Rooms were nice & big, bed was definitely the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept in. The waitresses at the casino were very good, they were around alot more than the waitresses at the strip casinos. Good buffet also. Only had one complaint and that was the free shuttle service - the bus is too small for the amount of people that want to take it. On the very first day we were there, there were about 40 people who wanted to take it in the morning, it only holds approx. 20 people. It doesn't matter if you are there first or not because there are different bus drivers so they stop at different spots at the pick-up area. We saw a number of upset people because they had been standing there for a half hour and weren't able to get on the bus, and someone who just got there was able to get on because they happen to be standing in the right spot. We were lucky because we managed to get on each time we wanted but only because we knew how this worked so we "strategially" placed ourselves somewhere in the middle and close to the curb. That would be the only reason we would not stay at this hotel again & would stay on the strip simply for the convenience of location.
reviews.title: Great! Except for...
Clean and Great Price
reviews.text: We stayed at the Orleans on a last moments notice for a family emergency. Not sure of what we would get for $57.00, we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were huge with extra space for guests to sit and talk or have a drink with. Extremely clean and updated furnishings. We usually stay at 4 or 5 star hotels, but nothing was available when we booked. This hotel was much nicer than most of the upscale hotels we've stayed at. Our party of 12 couldn't believe the quality of the rooms and furnishings at this low price! We really liked the fact that it didn't take us 20 minutes to walk from the front door to your room as in some of the huge hotels. They also had a great variety of restaurants. However we did notice smoke everywhere except in our rooms. The casino always seemed empty and no trouble in getting a table at any time. The location is just a short drive from the strip. The security was very good and room keys were needed for the elevators. The people staying at the hotel was a very mixed crowd, not like the 4 or 5 stars on the strip. Would stay there again for this unbelievable rate!!!

Just returned from an 8-day visit at The Orleans - After 3 visits it's still our favorite place to stay and play. We just want to warn those who are coffee or tea drinkers. The hotel has finally provided coffeemakers in the rooms. However, only the first cup of your stay is free. After that your room is charged $1.75 per cup for coffee and $1.25 for tea. Suggest you either bring with you or buy your own pods and tea bags and beat them at their own game. Otherwise this hotel is the best value, most low-limit tables, great restaurants, easy comps and roomy and comfortable accomodations. Their price matching policy is also great - was able to save a bundle on rooms rates by checking other sites.
reviews.title: Love The Orleans

reviews.text: Just returned from another great stay at the Orleans-2/25 thru 3/1. Had a family get-together for the three days with my brother and sister-in-law staying at Paris and my son and niece staying at Flamingo. Some comments in the forum were about the Saturday night check-in and whether the lines would be long. We arrived about 8PM and there was no line at all so check-in was a breeze. Rooms were in the new wing with good, not great views, of the strip at night. Breakfast was in the Cafe' and food was excellent with BIG portions. Shuttle to the strip was consistent and convenient. Did have to take a cab periodically though. This was our fifth stay and we have always been pleased with the people and services. Brought my mother-in-law with us for a return visit, gets around okay but uses a wheel chair for the distances associated with getting around in Vegas, she's 87. Its not Bellagio but we enjoy Orleans' atmosphere, casino and limits. My son and I also gambled at Imperial Palace, Ellis Island,Flamingo, Tropicana, Bally's, and Aladdin. The only place that disappointed us was Ellis Island because they didn't have "THE" craps table open and we had to play black jack since we had walked about a half-a-mile to get there from Bally's. Ate one night's meal at the Prime Rib Loft and had the best prime rib cut(Orleans' cut)of beef that I've had in years. All who got the prime rib agreed. We also had an excellent meal at the Au Sin(spelling?) restaurant in Paris and excellent heavy appetizers in the Forum(?) Restaurant near the lobby of Caesars' Palace prior to Celine Dion's show. All-in-all we all had a great time and I'm trying to convince my wife to take advantage of the room offer after Labor Day. Maybe there's hope!!
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

reviews.text: My name is Bruce M. Caplan and I've been at the Orleans three times during the past two months. Although I was doing a book signing at a hotel on the Strip, I found the Orleans a wonderful place to stay!
reviews.title: The Orleans Treats Patrons The Way Vegas Used To!

reviews.text: The rooms are gorgeous and very spacious. The hotel staff is the friendliest in Vegas. One feature I especially enjoyed about this vacation spot was the equal treatment of all guests! I could actually go to the coffee shop without someone charging ahead of me because they were a VIP gambler.
reviews.title: not like it used to be
Cannot believe this is ranked #2 on Trip Advisor out of all hotels in Vegas?!!
reviews.text: The Orleans has wonderful restaurants, over a dozen motion picture screens and even 70 bowling lanes. The pool area was spotless. Gambling too, so unless you have to, why go anywhere else?
During my most recent visit, I took my wife. She had great luck on their poker machine.
reviews.title: Has its merits, but overall disappointing

reviews.text: The strip hotels seem to rip the customers off on bottled water and cokes. The Orleans 24 hour gift shop sold 20 ounce bottles of water and soda for $1.35 per container.
reviews.title: Got the scabies in the Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Orleans for 5nights, 1-5 nov. Was pretty scared as it was off the strip and only a 3star. Usually we only do 5star and always move hotels if the standard isn't as we would expect. Have stayed at the luxor, bellagio and venetian before and this time had booked the Wynn which is probably the poshest hotel now on the strip but I thought it is crazy spending all this much money for a room which we will hardly be in and the orleans rated 6 on tripadvisor with good reviews so i thought lets go for it and save £700. I am so glad we did. The Orleans was probably the same standard as the luxor but for a much cheaper price and even though a 5min shuttle ride to the strip it drops you off in the best location, right in the middle of the strip. we never waited longer than 10mins for a bus. Don't walk it would take ages.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — No Sun on Pool in November

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got the whole 5 nights for £330 where all the other hotels eg aladdin and luxor and paris where around £700. The orleans had sold out on every website i checked for our first night stay but found a company called shilo inns that did it cheaper than expedia and was available for our whole trip so check out this site and it is under "affliates". I booked over the phone as I live in the uk.
reviews.title: Great stay, great view,

likes.disliked: — Long and disorganised lines for shuttle

reviews.text: When we arrived I was shocked to see such a big hotel just like those on the strip and how clean it was. The buffet breakfast was $6 (how cheap) and was no different from the aladdin buffet. We spent all day on the strip then at night if we didn't want to go out you have an irish bar, tgi's, bowling etc and it is cheap. The rooms were big and clean the bathroom plenty big enough with shower over bath, tv with movies etc. The pool area is really nice with hot tub but at this time of year was in the shade which was a shame as the temperatures were around 78. there are a few hotels on the strip though with the sun on that you could sneak in eg flamingo and the paris pool was lovely and they even offered us towels. The spa was nothing special but ok.
reviews.title: Orleans quality off strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have the money and want something really posh do the wynn or bellagio but otherwise spend the difference on yourselves in vegas and stay at the orleans as it has everything you could need and spend all day and night on the strip if you wish as all the hotels want you to spend your time and money in their hotels.
reviews.title: The Orleans Great Value

reviews.text: All the reviews on here were right!
reviews.title: Great value but some little annoyances

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's a little history if you will bear with me.
reviews.title: Got what we paid for at the Orleans

reviews.text: Booked the room directly by phone after checking other websites. As prices lowered I called and the operators always met the lowest price available. Keep checking internet prices after booking, it's a volatile market. Paid $55 a night after initial booking at over $70 a night for three midweek nights Oct 23-26
reviews.title: Just OK

likes.liked: — Don't fall for the cheap price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Vegas over 25 times in the last 30 years. First visit was to the Sands (now the site of the Venetian) and the Castaways Motel (now the Mirage) during the Rat Pack's reign, on the cusp of Howard Hughes early remake of Vegas. Each visit saw amazing changes. We have stayed at the old MGM (now Bally's), Imperial Palace, the old Aladdin, the Jockey Club, the Maxim (now gone), Harrahs, The Riviera, Bally's, The Hilton, Mirage, Rio, Venetian, in Mesquite (about 75 miles North of LV), and now The Orleans. In other words, from de luxe (Venetian) to de worst (The Riviera.)
reviews.title: Can't wait to go again

likes.disliked: — Unable to get a Dr Pepper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Orleans fits in neatly in the middle, good value, good accomodations, fair food at a fair price. Lots of (empty) poker tables, only two 3 card poker tables, no Spanish 21, which is our favorite table game. The pocket bathroom door is impossible to close without loud squeaks at 3 AM. At my age (70) late night visits are the norm . The coffee shop is well located and pretty good. Here's a tip, get your breakfast coffee at the lobby Starbucks and carry it to the coffee shop. The upstairs Prime Rib Room is so-so but the price is right. Chinese food pretty good. Other reviewers have covered all the other restaurants and other amenities.
reviews.title: Oh the Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have noted the parking is far from the room elevators. Security is on hand in the main elevator lobby but is ineffectual. A scuzzy looking character in front of us didn't show his keycard one evening. So neither did I. Neither of us was challenged. He didn't choose a floor so I did and we and he got off the elevator at my NON-SMOKING floor. He immediately lit up and parked himself on the floor lobby's couch to continue his loud cell phone conversation. About 10 minutes later I went out for ice and he was still talking and smoking. I went out again for soda a little later with same results. This time I said "This is a non smoking floor", as any one with a room there would know. He said "I know" and kept flagrantly puffing away. Not one to be ignored, I said "So why are you still smoking?" in my sweetest manner. Perhaps he detected some sarcasm when he retorted in a series of oaths. I kept walking but reported him (and the lackadasical lobby guard) to Security from my room. I checked later and he was gone. The moral, security is to make us feel good and just maybe deter the bad guys. Keep your eyes open.
reviews.title: Great room

likes.disliked: — Everything else being off the casino

reviews.title: Perfect!!
reviews.text: We just returned from Las Vegas and stayed at the Orleans Hotel. This hotel is located off the strip, so it is necessary to take a $5.00 cab ride to the strip, or wait for their free shuttle. We were very pleasantly surprised by the hotel itself. The rooms were very clean and LARGE!!! The restaurants we tried there were all very good. The casino was as big as any on the strip...just not as fancy. However, it was a comfortable casino and if you are new to gambling, was unpretentious. I had one of the best deep-tissue massages I have ever had in their spa. The only downside I could tell is that it is not as fancy as your more upscale hotels, but it is great for the price and nice to have somewhere quiet to go back too after a day or night spent on the strip.

reviews.title: Loved the Orleans
reviews.text: We just got back from our vacation in Las Vegas and we stayed at The Orleans. It wasn't far from the strip and very easy to get to. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. Probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at. I would definitely go back there again and highly recommend it to anyone going to Vegas.

Second stay at the Orleans in 2005 (Dec 10th-15th) and will be staying there again March 25th thru the 31st in 2006. (Visit Vegas 2 or 3 times a year) Still feel it is one of the nicer hotels we have stayed at in Vegas. Had a little problem this last time with a smell coming from the sink in the bathroom and they did offer to move us but we found out that by running a little water in sink it went away so we stayed in the room. Service again was great (tip the cleaners a few bucks a day, they deserve it) and they are always prompt to get us a fridge for medicines etc. Rooms are always clean and beds are comfy. We always rent a car but did use the shuttle one night to be able to partake in extra refreshments and found it to be ok. Highly recommend this hotel, check in for us has always been fast and the gals up front very helpful and friendly. Wife and I play low coin machines and always set a limit and I do love to play blackjack so end up going thru a few rounds a day of this. Again, I recommend you check this place out and will send another update in the Spring. Mike and Sue
reviews.title: Making this hotel a regular

reviews.text: What can I say, I was a little wary of The Orleans becasue of some of the reviews I had read. It was absolutely great! Everybody there was sooo friendly. The rooms were quite roomy, and the beds were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The restaurants had great food and service. We have been to Vegas several times, and stayed at a number of places, and we will definitely be back to stay at The Orleans. We had absolutely no complaints about anything at all there. Keep up the good work Orleans.
reviews.title: The Orleans was Wonderful
The Orleans is a great alternative to hotels on the Las Vegas Strip
reviews.text: My husband & I and our son & his fiancee just returned from a business trip to Las Vegas on 02/14/06. In the past we have stayed at a variety of big hotels located on Las Vegas Blvd., but with rising airline costs we were looking for a less expensive alternative. Based on the large number of positive reviews here and the affordable cost I booked 2 rooms for 6 nights from Feb. 8 to 14th and passed on hotels like the MGM, Riviera, Luxor, Imperial Palace, Bally's......

We stayed here March 20-23. We have 2 kids ages 11 and 14. They had a lot of fun. The arcade and bowling alley kept them very busy. We really liked the food. Kids loved the ice cream place. Pretty smoky in the casino, but what does one expect?? We will be back and we will stay here again. We had a room in tower 3 very clean and fairly new. Be ready to pay taxi fares to strip if you are not going to want to wait on the always full shuttle. It was about 17.00 each way for us with a tip. Great hotel and lots of fun!
reviews.title: tons of fun!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Orleans March 21st and 22nd and though the hotel rooms were their usual satisfactory quality, the craps tables for the three days and two nights were awful.
reviews.title: Good Rooms/Lousy Craps Tables/OK penny slots/Mexican Restaurant
I'm hard to please, but they did everything right!
reviews.text: Ask for a strip view without the $20 trick and they will accomodate you easily if available. We stayed on the 19th? floor--one below the top two executive floors--and the view of the strip was awesome. You could see from the shimmering Mandalay Bay on the right all the way to the Luxor Pyramid on the left. There was a problem with an odor that emanated from the sink and it was a sewer smell that we notice outside when we turned from Arville street into the parking lot was the same in the bathroom, so everytime we used the sink, you just have to keep the drain closed.

reviews.title: Very Pleasant Surprise
reviews.text: This was the second time the minimum on the craps tables were $5. I'm more of a low roller so this kept me off the tables during my stay there except when they lowered one of the tables to $3. Charting/watching the tables it didn't appear that anyone was winning. I could feel an air of desparation among the players that was quite noticeable and a lot of people chasing numbers with their bets and losing big. Most of the time, I played outside the hotel.

Penny slots.....Try the Men In Black machines on lyour way to the poker room. There are 6 machines next to each other and when they're hitting, players are walking away with 20, 30 , 50 $$$ at a time. You must play 20 lines a sping to get into bonus rounds. I did OK, my wife did better. She has more guts with the penny machines, while I'm more of a grinder--1,3, & 5 lines at a time till I see a pattern then maybe an 11 line and an occasional 20 line bet.
reviews.title: Orleans is a best kept secret!
Great Stay at Orleans
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Orleans 3/5 thru 3/11/05 for our 27th anniversary. The hotel was very nice and the rooms were large and very clean. The check-in was quick and easy and the personnel were very friendly. The buffet was a great value as was the cafe for a late bite with great specials after 11 pm. The Prime Rib Loft was a great place to eat. The prime rib was large sized and very good. We enjoyed the option of seeing a movie and bowling if we were so inclined. We had tickets for Bill Engval in the showroom and it was a great show and the seating was very comfortable. There were really no bad seats at all. My wife and I enjoyed the shuttle to their sister properties, the Barberry Coast and the Gold Coast. We never had a problem getting a seat and the trip is free.We enjoyed the huge casino and had a blast playing the slots and left with more than we came with. The $5 blackjack was a lot of fun and we pretty much broke even there. The dealers were very helpful and seemed to enjoy working here. For that matter even the housekeepers would smile and speak to you and we always were able to get anything for the room we asked for like extra pillows. The beds were very firm and comfortable and the couch and sitting area was nice for a breakfast or snack. The room service menu was large and very reasonably priced and the food was hot and tasty when it arrived. When we head back to Vegas we would definately stay here again.

reviews.title: better than average
reviews.text: We got a very reasonable deal, and even got a 19th floor nonsmoking room for the regular room rate. The view from the room was industrial South Las Vegas, and through the one square foot bathroom window we had a view of Mandalay Bay resort and Luxor. The room was clean and nicely furnished, but the mattress was of medium density foam and too soft. The pillow was equally annoying as being too springy. The air conditioner compressor was very loud which made it very difficult to sleep the first night. For nonsmokers, its not good, but it could be worse. We were concerned about not getting a nonsmoking room which is not guaranteed. The check-in area was too smoky and you have to go through a smoky area to reach the elevators to the rooms. Even if you go through the short cut to the parking garage, you still have to go through some smoky areas. If you eat there you have to go through the heavy smoke in the casino which is poorly ventilated. While the food at the buffet on Sunday was very good, the seafood buffet on Monday was overpriced at $17 for its weak and mostly frozen food selection. There was no problem with elevator wait. Parking was okay once we figured to park in the garage to avoid going through more smoke. Distance to the strip is too far to walk, and driving to the strip is very inconvenient with heavy traffic, difficult parking and the almost constant wail of emergency vehicle sirens.

reviews.title: Great Hotel-not so great location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Orleans Hotel from 3/13/05 to 3/16/05. There was no waiting for check in and a request for a refrigerator was immediately granted. (within 15 minutes). Refrigerator was an extra $15.00 a night but worth it. The room was very comfortable and well stocked with every possible nicety. Beds were very comfortable and the maid service kept the room immaculate. We ate at the Buffet several nights and the Cafe most mornings. The food was good and there were a lot of choices. I lost my walking cane in the casino the second night we were there so we were very limited to how much we could see and do in the rest of the town. No one ever turned it in. I don't know what someone would do with an old lady's cane but it was gone. The hotel is located quite a way from the strip and taxi fare to anywhere was around $20.00 a trip. The taxi drivers were extremely helpful and gave us some good tips includiing telling us to be sure to go to Fremont Street which we did and had an absolutely wonderful time listening to the music and watching the light show. Also gambled at Binnions and the Golden Nugget and were pretty lucky at both places. The casino at The Orleans is very big but most of it is video poker and nickle machines which we don't play. Quarter slots were very limited. The casino itself is beautiful and the staff there is very gracious. The location is a bit of a problem as it is far away from everything. We never did get to see the strip. I guess we will just have to back again. Darn!

Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Orleans, and I was fairly satisfied. We had a view of the parking lot (cool!) from our 7th floor room, but what can be expected during Spring Break when pretty much everything else in Vegas is booked? I found the layout of the hotel lobby/casino very disorienting and confusing--more so than most Vegas hotels. Parking was a nightmare--but again, I can't complain because I knew it would be crazy! The food at the 24-hour cafe (I already forget the name)was average but VERY salty. The waitstaff were friendly enough but they looked drained and a little beaten down, which was slightly depressing. The shuttle service was great and the drivers had a good attitude and seemed to enjoy interacting with the travelers. I thought our room was quite clean and nicely decorated for the price. What's up with the sliding bathroom doors though?? There's no lock on them and they don't quite shut all the way (or maybe it was just ours) which is slightly annoying when you're in a room with 3 other people...We sat out in the pool area for awhile and I was pretty impressed with the size and the "look" of it all. I'm sure it will be a lot more enjoyable once the winds die down and the temp. goes up 10 degrees. Overall, I would probably stay here again but wouldn't want to pay more than $70-80 per night.
reviews.title: Some good and some bad
Nice and clean
reviews.text: All the other positive reviews on the Orleans are unbelievably true! This place is great. Checkin was a breeze. Front desk people actually had a personality. I had made some changes to my reservation prior to checkin, and all changes were made without any problems.

I stayed at the Orleans in March in 2004. I have also stayed at a well-known hotel/casino on the Strip. I want to point out that the Orleans is GREAT for the money. This place has a HUGE casino, great food, clean/nice rooms, and great service. I highly reccommend this hotel/casino to anyone. Sure, its off the strip, but it only takes you a couple of minutes to get there. I ended up playing at the Orleans casino way more than any of the more popular casinos on the strip. The hotel I stayed on the strip cost twice as much as the Orleans, and the rooms were not as nice, the casino sucked, the food was gross, but.. it was on the strip. That is what I was paying for. Its a couple of minutes to the strip and the shuttle always arriving/departing. Also, its one of those places that if you don't feel like leaving your hotel all day, there is enough stuff to do. The rooms were just average rooms, nothing fancy, but very clean. When in Vegas, who stays in their room anyway? So, why would anyone pay $300 a night? This is a great place for singles, families, old and young. I will definitely stay there when I go back!
reviews.title: Great Place!!
Loved it all!!
reviews.text: Stayed here because of the price. Coming back in a week to get married-staying again. Hotel was super. All was super. Easy check-in-friendly staff, GREAT slots.

Stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of May 2006. We've stayed here before a couple of times and never been disappointed. Check in and check out was speedy. Room was clean and tidy with a pool view. Coupon books issued at check in were great for free cocktails, beers and such and for discounts at the on-site restaurants and coffee shop. Used the shuttle bus to the Barbary Coast a few times and didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes at either end.
reviews.title: Great stay, enjoyed every minute of the Orleans!
Great deal
reviews.text: Played the slots in the casino a little and found them to be quite "loose". Got free show tickets to see Gordon Lightfoot in the Orleans Showroom. Ate in Don Miguels Mexican restaurant, was OK but not brilliant. TGI Fridays on the other hand was great, ate there three or four times, food was excellent. The Lounge bands were very good and the Cocktail waitresses were swift with the free drinks whilst gambling.

reviews.title: Great Place To Stay!
reviews.text: To sum up, a great stay, enjoyed it thoroughly and wouldn't hesitate to return in the future.

reviews.title: pleasantly suprised
reviews.text: Our first trip to Vegas March 28-30th. My husband and I stayed at the Orleans with their Mardi Gras Package. What a great deal. The room was very clean with a nice comfortable bed. I was concerned with being off the strip but the package deal was so appealing. Although the shuttle was sometimes crowded it was very convenient and quick to get us to the Barbary Coast in the heart of the strip. (we had a great time learning craps with the free lessons at the Barbary Coast) We stayed there on a Monday so we got to enjoy the complimentary seafood buffet (as part of our package), it was fantastic, amazing variety of all types of food (especially crab!!) the breakfast buffet was also wonderful. After a long day of wandering around the strip, we found returning to the Orleans had a very homey appeal. Staff were friendly all around. We would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: We Will never stay at the Orleans again
reviews.text: We had heard and read a lot of good things about the Oleans in Las Vegas Nevada. We decided to stay at the hotel on our vacation. Boy, what a mistake that turned out to be. We booked a room in Jan. for March of 2005. We had paid with a credit card believing that the room we booked would be held for us. This turned out to be far from the truth. We booked a no smoking room. We don't really mind everyone smoking in the casinos otherwise we wouldn't go to Vegas. But we really don't want to sleep in a room that smells like a used ash tray. Sadly, that is just what was waiting for us at the Orleans. When we arrived at the hotel to check in we were told that all that was left were smoking rooms. We explained to the clerk that we had booked a no smoking room clear back in January and had already paid for the room. She said that they can't guarentee the room you get. I must, however say that we did get in to Vegas late because our flight had been delayed. We arrived at about 11:00pm. The clerk was very rude to us and plainly did not care about our problem. We were given a choice to either take a smoking room or not have a room. I asked if it would be possible to get a no smoking room that next day. The clerk said she would put in a request for it and asked if we still wanted the room. Needless to say that at 11:00 at night we did not have to much of a choice. We spent a very sleepless night in the smoking room. The next morning we went down to have breakfast and check on the status of our already paid for room that we did not get. To make a long story short we were told to keep checking back three times . We got the room but wasted a whole day. We got the room at 3:00pm. We found the service bad and will not stay at the Orleans again. We contacted the Coast Casinos and didn't any answer back from them for two weeks. They just said that they hoped our next stay would be better. We decided to not spend any more money at the Orleans or gamble there . We had a bad vacation due to a bad hotel.

We had a great stay at The Orleans April 2-3! We arrived at 11:00 a.m. and had no probably with checking in early; in fact, we were given a free upgrade to the executive king suite as the hotel was overbooked. We had our daughter with us so a roll-away bed was provided and was in our room before we walked in just a few minutes after check-in. The room was spacious and clean and the king bed was very comfortable; my daughter said the roll-away bed was much better than the queen bed she'd slept in the night before at a different hotel! Everyone we met on the staff was friendly and helpful; from the front desk staff to the security officers stationed near the elevators, to the servers in the various restaurants, clerks in the gift shops and even the maids. We had lunch in the Courtyard Cafe and it was very good, my husband especially enjoyed the Chinese Lunch special. We also had snacks in the ice cream cafe and coffee at Seattle's Best. The reviewer who commented on the registration area and the rest of the casino being too smoky must have had bad luck ~ we actually found the whole casino and registration area to be virtually smoke free which we were also pleased about since we had our daughter with us. While our suite was not 'non-smoking' the air was fresh and clean and didn't smell like stale smoke/cigarrettes. If it wasn't for the ashtrays located throughout the rooms, we wouldn't have known it was a smoking room! We were in Vegas for a family wedding and after visiting them at a couple of the other hotel/casinos located on the strip, we were even more pleased with The Orleans ~ our relatives were wishing they'd booked at The Orleans also! We would recommend this hotel to anyone and plan to be back on our next trip to Vegas!
reviews.title: Delighted ~ We'll be back!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Orleans March 28-31. Check-in was quick and easy but the young woman that checked us in was not very friendly. She was not rude just not friendly. Our room was large and very clean. The decore is nothing fancy but it is nice and appeared rather new. The hotel seemed busy but we never waited more than 35 or 40 seconds for an elevator. The buffets are reasonably priced and the food was good. At breakfast they prepare eggs "to order". Terrible Mikes has great burgers and fries. We purchased a few drinks at the bars and found the prices to be very reasonable and they did not skimp on the liquor. The casino was large but is very smokey. There is too much video poker for my taste and I was disappointed that they have no "Let it ride" tables. Other than that no complaints. We attended a hockey game at the arena which is an excellent facility. Overall I would rate this property very good to excellent and an exceptional value for the price. We will stay here again for certain.
reviews.title: The Orleans delivers
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: We booked the Orleans Hotel based on feedback on this sight, and we were very pleased. The room was clean, spacious, light and totally great. The shuttles were very frequent, and we just caught one to the 'Gold Coast', then caught the one from there to the Barbary Coast, which is right on the Strip.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel, But!!
reviews.text: Easy parking. Excellent front desk. Nice room. Nice employees in the Hotel, Restaurants, and Bars. The food is good. I wasn't sure what to think of the Casino employees?? Poor location in an industrial area. The free transportation to the strip was never very good. With all of the options in Las Vegas, I will stay at another Hotel next year.

General: Lots of good places to eat. The multi-cultural buffet was delicious and very inexpensive. I only was able to have lunch there. Their 24 hour cafe was awesome (also used for room service!), I ate off their 'American' menu as well as their chinese menu. Their War Wonton Soup and Hong Kong noodles were awesome. Drinks were delicious. Wait staff are very very sexy in their revealing but tasteful outfits. General staff were pleasing to deal with. 4 of 5 (only because $$$$ can buy you the Bellagio or Venetian). Security was tight going up to the rooms. Valet was quick and friendly. I didn't use the shuttle service but it seemed to be picking up and dropping off all the time. The coupon book has lots of very usable coupons. There is a huge movie theater as well as a 70 lane bowling alley. In addition a big arcade area and day care! We didn't stay long enough to do movies and 24/7 bowling. Next time!
reviews.title: What a great find! (learn the shortcut around the casino!)
OK
reviews.text: Rooms: with the Master Card special rate, we booked a deluxe room with a pool/mountain side view. Gorgeous view, ultra clean rooms and lots of toiletries. Ask for a room as far from the elevator for the best views! It was spring break when I went, and we were making more noise than whatever was happening in the hall. The A/C thermostat was a bit messed up and the pocket bathroom door was different, but it didn't take away from the room at all (cant beat $70 night suite with 2 queen beds). No fridge or microwave, but I called down for a small fridge and they had one brought up. LOTS OF TOILETRIES. Room service was prompt and yummie and inexpensive for all that we ordered..two coctails, two entrees and two appetizers for about $60 + tip!! They decor was a bit dated, but I didn't care. The beds were comfortable, cable channels a bit lacking, but I'm not in Vegas to stay camped out in the room and watch tv!

reviews.title: Best slots in Vegas!
reviews.text: Spa/Pool: It wasn't super sunny weather, but I must say I was very impressed with the pool area. There is an outside bar next to the pool and lots of loungers around the pool area. I'm going to bet when its hot hot hot in the following months, this will be very ideal to hang out and relax there. It just wasn't happening because of the overcast weather. The wife used the spa facilities for a full sweedish massage as well as the 'Queen Facial'. She said it was one of the best massages she had ever gotten and the facial was soo relaxing and very complete that she fell asleep. She rates the service 5 of 5 but the facilities, having painted concrete walls recieve only 3 of 5. The spa area includes sauna, jacuzzi and lots of excercise equipment. Use the coupon in the book for a free day at the spa!

Casino: Join the comps program! They have 3 different systems for table/slots/poker room. Slots and Table play add points together and with the very loose slots (at least on the video poker machines) it comps you on your wins per hand played! Poker room pays a monetary amount but I'm not sure of all the details. I only played a total of 6 hours in the poker room. I must say that this casino is very nicely set up. They have bunches and bunches of video poker machines everywhere and many of them progressives! They also have regular slots as well as video slots. What I really liked was the spacing between the rows/groups of machines. I never was ever bumped or run into or ever felt clausterphobic while playing slots. The cocktail waitresses were very timely with drinks and refills. Their table games were always populated. And they had more lower limit tables than higher limit tables, but their min/max limits seemed to be very friendly. The poker room was HUGE! Wonderful floor staff for reservations for the different type of limits as well as a tournament always happening. check the schedule, I didn't get up in time to enter their morning tournament $100 buyin and 1 rebuy, but on a Sunday they got close to 200+ players. YES LOTS OF LOCALS, so be prepared to be playing your best game of Hold 'Em. LOCALS are very nice. They are friendly and explain new things to the visitors and give good advice to novices about how to play and even where to go eat! I felt very at home playing poker there. Next time I'll play in the tournament. You know, I feel a lot more confident in my poker play after playing with those veteran wise men. I got spanked on some very notable strong hands at a 4/8 table. Capped on pocket aces only to be beat on the river by a set of Q's; set of Qs to be beat by river set of Ks.
reviews.title: Misled at check-in (big time)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a conference here in April and was very happy with this off-strip hotel. Good food, decent drinks and a free shuttle bus into the strip whenever you need it. Rooms were large with good housekeeping and friendly staff. For the price, can't complain !
reviews.title: Quite good

likes.disliked: — Was a touch for the 'older' crowd

reviews.text: Nature of visit:
reviews.title: Great

likes.liked: — The room while small was clean

reviews.title: As Always - A Great Stay
reviews.text: Stayed at the Orleans to play in their poker tournaments, which run three times daily. Talked to the poker room manager, the tournament struture is great and for the price 80 bucks, gives you a good gamble. Remember, most tournaments are nothing more than a turkey shoot. The blinds goes up so fast and the rounds are so short, you have to play any two card and hope for the best. NOT AT THE ORLEANS. The blind struture at the Orleans is excellent with 30 min rounds, that gives you a lot a lot of play. Poker skills will pay off here.
Room: The room was neat and very clean. Not huge, but who comes to Vegas and spends their time in the room.
reviews.title: You don't have to stay on the Strip to enjoy Vegas
Fabulous
reviews.text: Service. I had to call security twice. Each time they were up to my room within 10 mins (I messed up the safe in the room and needed it opened).

Stayed here with my 14 year old son and husband from March 17 to the 20th ,2008. Weather was hot ! in the 80s and we had a great room comfy and clean. So quiet too ! Perfect off the strip hotel and we all can't wait to go back. NOT crowded at all. The line ups for the buffet in the morning were short if you arrived before 10am. Food was good and plentiful. $7 a person. Good value. Pool was great. One toddler pool, one longish one and a huge circular hot tub...beautiful.
reviews.title: Great Family Stay !!

likes.liked: — Big clean room non smoking room. Comfy beds and nice view.

reviews.text: On our last day we came up from the pool and we had no water in our room. We called and they explained they had an emergency and the water in our entire tower was out for about 2 hours. My husband quickly called down to the Spa/Fitness Centre and they said we could use the facilities no problem !! It is part of the resort $5 a day fee you pay ! Make use of it folks !! Gorgeous facility ! Besides the huge shower stalls it had a sauna and a huge whirlpool with nobody in it ! Free use of the toiletries and they had ice cold water in the fridge !! Anyway, we came back to our room and still had no water. My husband called the manager and left a voice mail about his concerns since we were on our way out to a formal dinner and still couldn't use the water. The next day when we checked out the manager had credited our account with one free night stay !!! We thought that was acceptable since it was a hassle going to the spa to shower ! ( even if it was a nice spa ! )
reviews.title: Very disappointed

likes.liked: — the square footage of the room

reviews.title: Love this hotel!
reviews.text: We also rented a car from Budget which was conveniently located accross the street. The hotel gets a better rate for you, so go through the Bell Desk .

Took my son to Gameworks which is an awesome arcade on the strip next to MGM. Paid $35 for a day pass. HE DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE EVEN AFTER 5 HOURS. So we took him back after dinner for a few more hours. Great games for all ages.
reviews.title: Stayed at The Orleans

likes.liked: — Great, free fitness center. And the price.

reviews.text: When we did take a cab from the hotel to the strip we payed about $10 mid day. We also took a cab back to the airport and it cost around $17 . That was early in the am. and no traffic of course.
reviews.title: Great Rooms and Staff

reviews.text: My family of 3 stayed at this hotel for several days in March 2008. We drove to the hotel on Sunday at about 4 PM. It was easy to get to from the airport.
reviews.title: Big and Clean Room, Poor Housekeeping

likes.liked: — Big room, comfy beds, very reasonable rate

reviews.text: Unfortunately, there was no designated spaces for hotel guests to unload their luggage in front of the hotel. The valet guy told me that we could park by the curb at a spot across 5 lanes of cars from the hotel front entrance, and unload our stuff, but we had to give him our car key (in a sense, valet parking) unless at least one of us stayed with the car during our registering. I did not want to pay for valet parking just for registering and unloading our luggage, so I parked at the spot he pointed out, went inside the hotel myself to register while my wife and my son stayed in the car.
reviews.title: Everything the strip has at 1/2 off
Fab Stay
reviews.text: As soon as I entered the hotel, I smelled cigarette, which was stronger than I expected, because the registration counter is on the fringe of the casino area so that the smoke generated by smoking gamblers was distributed all through the ground floor. The cigarette smell was barely tolerable. Las Vegas appeared to be the cigarette smoking capital of the U.S. because every where I went on the ground floor of each of the Las Vegas hotels and the areas outside the Las Vegas hotels, I ran into people smoking.

I had to wait only 5 minutes for my turn to register inside the hotel. The woman who checked me in was friendly. AFter I had gotten my computer card room keys, I returned to our car, unloaded the luggage and told my wife and son to wait by our luggage outside the hotel. I then drove to park in the parking lot of the Orleans Arena next door to the hotel. I walked for about 8 minutes back to the front entrance of the hotel to meet my wife and son, and proceeded to our room with our luggage.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Rooms

likes.liked: — Room with a window that opens!! Location, and Value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both my wife and my son commented how strong the cigarette smell was in the "lobby" of the hotel. The elevators to the rooms were located about 5 minutes walk from the hotel front entrance, on the fringe of the casino. Thus, the Orleans Hotel is not as bad as the large hotels on the strip in terms of the distance from the hotel entrance to the elevators to go up to the guest rooms.
reviews.title: Orleans - Big rooms and good value for money!

reviews.text: I guess you can say it was okay. The price was fair for what you got. We stayed April 29th to May 4th, 2006. Online booking and the check in both went smooth. The rooms were big. The décor was nice. Our room 887 had a view of nothing. We did find a razor blade in our room. It was on top of the TV stand, which is high, but we came across it anyway. We called the Manager, since we had small kids with us, and he/she didn't care. They just sent someone up to get it, so look around before you get comfy in your room. The beds were a bit stiff and the pillows were small. Room service was good, fast and expensive. The window in the bathroom was different but we liked it. However, if the generator (or what ever it was) is running it will be very loud and stink your room. It could have just been our floor to experience this. The food and service at the Courtyard, TGI Fridays and Terrible Mike's was excellent, and the prices were good! It was very expensive in the Buffet; so don't go there for breakfast with the entire Family! You’re better off to go get a bagel, muffin, or fruit in the downstairs express stores. The liquor store came in very handy. Good prices too. The pool was awesome. The kiddy pool was a hit with my kids. I really enjoyed myself in the pool area. Just an FYI, there is only 1 waitress and 1 bartender, so service could get slow at times. My niece cut her foot on the pool cement getting out of it. My sister had to do a ton of paperwork as a result. We went bowling and the kids did enjoy it until some guy on a power trip shut off their game in the 8th frame. I complained, again, and no one cared. They said it was because we had an extra player, which was BS, as everyone had shoes and we were on our second game! Also, you may also want to keep in mind the price of cab rides, very expensive, if you go someplace else or don’t feel like walking. We went from our hotel to Fremont Street, $20 one way! We did use the shuttle to Barbary Coast and found it to be a bonus, plus the driver was friendly. Oh yah, I really like the amount of security at this hotel. The bottom line is I won’t stay at this hotel again and here's why 1) I found it expensive, but what isn't in Vegas these days 2) it is far away from everything else, referring to the the strip and Fremont, and 3) the management staff was not very accommodating and/or considerate, which makes a big difference.
reviews.title: It's was Okay

reviews.text: I stayed at the Orleans May 4-8, 2006. This is a budget hotel but I was nicely surprised. First of all the room was very clean. Nicely decorated. Every room has a nice view of Vegas. Elevators are quick and there is great security - no one gets on an elevator unless they have a room key. As a woman alone I greatly appreciated this aspect.
reviews.title: Best little deal in Vegas!

reviews.text: I had a room with 2 double beds. Crisp sheets. My only complaint was the mushy bed. But I slept fine every night. Skimpy pillows, but they didn't bother me. Superb working air conditioner. It was extremely quiet. I could not even hear my friends in the room next door at all! Never heard anyone below or above me. This is all important to me when traveling.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Orleans!
The Orleans Was Good
reviews.text: The room was spacious and included a cute living area with couch and coffee table, lamps, etc. Bathroom included dressing area. All very clean. Cable TV and web hook ups. I ordered up a refrigerator (also very clean) for $15 extra per night. Room had iron and board.

There is a TGIF restaurant downstairs, a bowling alley, movie theaters, and an adequate cafe and buffet. Although I liked the cafe much better than the buffet, the breakfast buffet was only $6.99 and had everything from biscuits and gravy to eggs benedict to pancakes and waffles and chinese and mexican food too!
reviews.title: Good hotel to stay at in Vegas
